page.title: 08St. Cuthberts Church Cont
page.content: for Southport at the coronation of Queen Elizabeth II.Immediately above is the royal coat of arms, and on either side of the recess containing the font are the warden's and rector's pews.In the north-west corner of the church is a painted wooden board giving a list of benefactors of{ {NORTH MEOLS GRAMMAR SCHOOL.}Originally the school stood immediately to the south-west of the church, but in 1859 transferred to the site in St. Cuthbert's Road now occupied by the council school.Proceeding eastwards, a bronze tablet records the names of parishioners who lost their lives in the First World War.Another panel denotes the same for the Second World War.The nearby Meols Hall was used as a hospital from 1915-1918, and the names of five soldiers who died there
